meanings.definition: To attack continuously with bombs or artillery.
meanings.sent1: During the war, the enemy bombards the city day and night.
meanings.sent2: The military bombards the enemy's positions to weaken their defenses.
meanings.sent3: The noisy neighbor bombards us with loud music every evening.
meanings.sent4: The storm bombards the coast with heavy rain and strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The media bombards us with news updates every hour.

meanings.sent1: The telemarketer bombards me with calls even after I said no.
meanings.sent2: The bully bombards the smaller kids with insults and threats.
meanings.sent3: My little sister bombards me with questions as soon as I get home.
meanings.sent4: The paparazzi bombards the celebrity with cameras and questions.
meanings.sent5: The salesman bombards me with offers to buy things I don't need.

meanings.definition: A type of large cannon used in the past.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle displayed old bombards used in battles.
meanings.sent2: The museum had a collection of bombards from different historical periods.
meanings.sent3: The pirate ship had a massive bombard ready to fire at enemy vessels.
meanings.sent4: The army museum showcased a variety of bombards used in wars.
meanings.sent5: The medieval reenactment featured a working bombard to demonstrate its power.
